Azure Cloud Architect ( 100% Remote ) Nearshore Project - Swiss Client - Jobmote

Azure Cloud Architect ( 100% Remote ) Nearshore Project - Swiss Client

Azure Cloud Architect ( 100% Remote ) Nearshore Project - Swiss Client - English Speaking Azure Cloud Architect required by our Switzerland based client. This project is 100% remote and can be done from any European Country. Expert in Azure PaaS, Serverless (Azure Functions) Ideally also expert in IaaS. Powershell expert design secure and compliance by design components together with Solution architect, E2E architects and Digital Security. Your initial contract will run until the end of the year with a view to extend, please send a copy of your latest profile, we have interview slots for this week still. items.title: Contract Remote Microservice Security Architect (located in the US) at Twin Technologies
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=3, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=43, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Consulting, Design, Digital Agency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javasecurityjenkinsdevopsdockersysadmin

Job description

Company Description

We dream, create, and deliver digital solutions that transform what’s possible for enterprises, government institutions and organizations and partner with our clients through every stage of digital transformation: from strategy, to activation, to delivery to decrease risk and increase speed-to-market.

We are Remotely Awesome! We understand that quality of life directly impacts quality of work, and we know that talent is all over the place. Our team is not limited by geography, and seeks top talent where it exists. Our remote work model encourages independent thinking, requires professional discipline, and contributes to a high quality work/life balance.

What’s does this mean for you? Many of our team members have the flexibility to work from anywhere in the United States, and is provided the tools and infrastructure to successfully collaborate across the globe. We will continue to grow and evolve with the market and provide an environment where creativity, leadership, mentoring, planning, and resources are in place to achieve our shared goals.

Job Description

The Security Architect will serve as part of a development team supporting both established projects and creating from the ground up. The ideal candidate is an experienced leader and team player with a background in security and a passion for delivering well through DevOps best practices.  They are passionate about technology and committed to lifelong learning, possessing the ability to apply their technical knowledge, skills and experience to solve complex/real-world problems.

Technologies and Disciplines:

We use several different technologies in our development stack across multiple clients and projects. We continuously evaluate new technologies to make sure we are fully aware and always using the right tool for the job. Examples of the technologies we currently use include:

  • Java, JPA, Dropwizard, JBoss, Javascript
  • Docker, Kubernetes, Linkerd, Consul
  • SQL Server, Oracle
  • Jenkins, Maven, Stash, Git
  • AWS EC2, Lambda, S3

Responsibilities:

  • Solving complex problems with elegant and maintainable solutions
  • Designing, implementing, and evaluating microservice architecture implementations to improve delivery and support new features
  • Delivering back-end and tooling solutions using modern Java frameworks
  • Developing and bringing security processes in line with current best practices
  • Integrating existing legacy Java enterprise system with microservice/mesh architecture based APIs
  • Working with the team to continuously improve security across all areas of the software project
  • Participating on an agile / scrum software delivery team

Qualifications

  • A strong foundation in computer security and authz & authn best practices
  • 5-10+ years software engineering experience
  • 1-2+ years experience integrating with Identity and Access Management frameworks, or security policy and enforcement toolsets.
  • Secured APIs and services within SOA or microservice architectures
  • Experience with Kubernetes resource APIs and related CLI tools
  • Experience with running and defining Docker containers
  • Comfortable using and configuring software on Linux based operating systems
  • Familiar with service mesh proxies like Istio/Envoy or Linkerd
  • Understands best practices for JWT algorithm choice and token claim assertions
  • Capable of integrating security related components into CI/CD automation pipelines using tools like Spinnaker or Jenkins
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Applicants MUST be US Citizens, due to the nature of the work
  • Applicants MUST live in the US, with a remote home office
  • This is a contract position to start

Additional Information

Twin Technologies offers a competitive and comprehensive employee compensation and benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision insurance, LTD, STD, life insurance, 401k program with company match, and an unlimited PTO plan

Twin Technologies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Apply now

About Twin Technologies

At Twin Technologies, Inc. we dream, create, and deliver digital solutions that transform what’s possible for enterprises, government institutions and organizations. We partner with our clients through every stage of digital transformation: from strategy- to activation - to delivery, while we decrease risk and increase speed-to-market.

Twin has been a “Remotely Awesome” company for the past 14+ years and continues to master best practices and strategies around collaboration, communication, and tools, across our high-performing distributed teams.

What’s does this mean for you?  We will continue to grow and evolve with the market to provide an environment where creativity, leadership, mentoring, and some of the best resources are in place to achieve high standards in the consulting and digital space

You will work on a variety of projects that integrate digital designs into products, services and environments. 

Twin Technologies offers a competitive and comprehensive employee compensation and benefits package, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, LTD, STD, life insurance, a 401k plan with company match, and an unlimited PTO plan.

Twin Technologies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Benefits

  • annual stipend for hardware
  • progressive 401k matching plan
  • generous health and dental coverage
  • growth, support, and mentorship
  • company hosted and sponsored events
  • training and conferences stipend
  • telecommuting reimbursement program
  • unlimited PTO
  • work remote from home office
  • work with amazing people

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

security

Job description

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong knowledge of NIST SP 800-53 & SP 800-30
  • Experience in conducting audits based on NIST Cyber Security Framework & NIST security controls
  • Experience in developing technical risk management framework and managing security risk assessments
  • Must have CISSP

Sorry, No Visas. Must be located in the US and/ or Canada.

Background verification required.

Apply now

About Surge

Surge is a leading provider of custom web, cloud, mobile, digital, and desktop software development and consulting services to clients in every industry, from hot startups to Fortune 500 companies. Founded in 2007, and listed on the Inc. 5000 list of America's fastest-growing companies for five straight years, the Surge team has successfully delivered hundreds of software products, apps, and solutions to its clients using a proven agile/scrum development process combined with an elite group of North American software professionals. Simply put, Surge offers America's best software engineers, on demand, at rates 30-50% less than the competition.

Benefits

  • Great Pay
  • Choose Your Hours
  • Work From Home
  • Work With Happy People
  • Zero Commute
  • See Your Family More
  • Travel While You Work
  • Software Provided

items.title: Engagement Security Lead Bristol, London or Remote £100k
items.content:
Engagement Security Lead Bristol, London or Remote £100k - Jobmote

Engagement Security Lead Bristol, London or Remote £100k

Oliver James Associates

Engagement Security Lead | An interesting opportunity has just opened up for an Engagement Security Lead to undertake a unique role with a FTSE 100 Financial Services organisation who have a global reach

Engagement Security Lead | Bristol, London or Remote| £100k

Engagement, Security, CISO, Stakeholder Engagement, Cyber, Security, Leadership, Experience.

The Role

Engagement Security Lead | An interesting opportunity has just opened up for an Engagement Security Lead to undertake a unique role with a FTSE 100 Financial Services organisation who have a global reach. The Engagement Security Lead can be based out of either Bristol, London or can work remotely and will be responsible for managing and contributing towards the delivery of change initiatives within the UK CISO function, whilst also providing guidance and oversight to ensure that all business areas remain compliant with security standards. This role will suit a self-starter who has previous experience within a leadership role, in a security and risk conscious environment.

Engagement Security Lead Requirements

  • Excellent understanding of IT Risk and Risk Management
  • Experience of risk assessments across change initiatives
  • Ability to multi-task and to deliver against tight deadlines, under pressure
  • Ability to drive the right culture and behaviour in response to information around vulnerabilities etc
  • Extensive experience of working in a security-oriented role
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Stakeholder engagement and relationship building with C-suite professionals
  • Willingness to travel

This role is urgent and we will be shortlisting for interview ASAP so do not miss out - please apply now for immediate consideration.

In addition to Bristol and London, this role can also be REMOTE. In exchange for your expertise, there is a salary of up to £100,000 on offer plus benefits.

Engagement, Security, CISO, Stakeholder Engagement, Cyber, Security, Leadership, Experience.

Engagement Security Lead | Bristol, London or Remote| £100k

items.title: Senior PHP Developer with Security Emphasis at Defiant Inc
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=38, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

phpwordpressmysqlapachenginx

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Do you want to work in cyber security? How about being able to work anywhere on the Planet? On a beach in Hawaii, or taking your lunch break fly fishing a stream in Alaska.

We are one of the fastest growing cyber security companies in the World. You will be working for us remotely full-time, with full benefits including platinum level medical, dental, 401K, a generous stock options package, gym reimbursement, company paid security certifications (CISSP, Security+) and conferences.

We are a team of 33 talented and highly motivated people. We're fast moving, nimble, self managing and work in a relaxed atmosphere with a sense of humor. Rather than working for a mega-corp, you will be working in a company where your work has real impact in the fun high-growth stages of our evolution.

We use apps like Slack, Fogbugz, Github and Google Apps for our workflow. Each team member is world-class at what they do. We have flexible working hours and we are a diverse team ranging in age. Most of us are based in the USA and many are international including countries like Sweden, Bulgaria, the UK and many more.

Here are some of the core skills we look for in team members:

  • A willingness to grab whatever task is required of you and run with it. This may include work outside of your core tasks. We are a small team and everyone needs to pitch in.
  • A high level of productivity and self-management.
  • Must be comfortable working remotely and interfacing with other team members using Slack and other remote tools.
  • Excellent analytical ability and problem solving skills.
  • A strong work ethic.
  • Effective communication skills. This is critical for remote workers and we can't emphasize this enough. You will spend a significant amount of time interfacing with our customers and/or other team members through your keyboard and it's critically important that you can effectively convey your thoughts.

REQUIREMENTS

  • PHP including object oriented PHP. Experience with Laravel is helpful. You need to write clean, high performance and maintainable code that is secure.
  • Knowledge of subversion and git, including github workflow is a requirement.
  • MySQL including the ability to write well performing SQL, ability to design schemas and an understanding of MySQL data types and performance.
  • Experiencing with Apache, Nginx and other web platforms like Lightspeed highly desirable.
  • Must be comfortable using Linux and comfortable with Linux administration.
  • HTML, CSS, Javascript and jQuery a requirement.
  • Understanding of common web vulnerabilities required.
  • Vulnerability research – ability to identify vulnerabilities in code is a requirement.
  • WordPress experience required – including ability to use the WordPress plugin API.
  • A keen interest in infosec. Credentials like Security+, CISSP or other is a strong plus.
  • Knowledge of other languages a strong plus.

All positions require a trial period of approximately 2-3 weeks with a minimum commitment of 10 hours per week. You will be paid for this short-term contract, and it will be used to evaluate whether both parties want to pursue an ongoing, regular employment relationship.

All offers of employment are contingent on successful completion of a background check. The results of the background check are considered as they relate to the position and do not automatically disqualify someone from a offer of employment with the company.

BENEFITS

Full-time permanent positions include the following benefits:

  • Platinum level PPO medical plan with dental and vision included. Company pays 100% of the premiums for employees and 50% for dependents.
  • 21 days PTO per year
  • 401k with matching contributions
  • Opportunities to attend security conferences and WordCamps (conferences vary but we have attended RSA, DefCon, BSides, Shmoocon and others)
  • Company paid local gym membership
  • Company paid fees and study time provided for work-related educational courses and security certifications such as Security+, CEH and CISSP.
  • You will receive a new laptop (MacBook Pro or equivalent) and any items needed to create a successful work environment at home.

Click here to apply for this job now.

Apply now

About Defiant Inc

Defiant makes Wordfence, the most popular security product for WordPress. We protect over 1 million active websites from hackers, bots and spam. We are fast growing with a friendly and talented remote working team. We provide an excellent base package with full benefits that include 401k, awesome medical, dental, options, and 21 days of PTO. We make sure our team members have all the latest in laptop or workstation technology and everything else they need to do an awesome job from anywhere in the World. 

Benefits

  • Remote working.
  • Friendly relaxed culture.
  • Fast paced.
  • Platinum level PPO medical plan.
  • 21 days PTO per year.
  • 401k with matching contributions.
  • Opportunities to attend security conferences and Wordcamps.
  • Company paid local gym membership.
  • Company paid fees & study time for work-related courses/certifications
  • Hardware/software/gear provided for a successful home work environment

items.title: Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote
items.content:
Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote - Jobmote

Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote

Slait Consulting

SLAIT Consulting is currently seeking a Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect for our client in Dallas, TX. This is a remote position with some travel required. SUMMARY: The Cyber Security Solutions Architect is responsible for working with both BDS Business Development & account/pursuit sales leadership to define security specific solution strategy. JOB DUTIES /RESPONSIBILITIES: * Responsible for leading the development of technical solutions in the area of cyber security services and offerings. * Ensure the soundness of an integrated security solution and proper BDS Delivery assurance signoff of any/all proposals. * Primary point contact responsible to ensure governance processes (Ex - Rainbow & BDS Governance) are followed and managed pro-actively through the lifecycle of the pursuit/engagement. * Engages with the client, identifies cyber security needs/requirements, engages with SMEs and bid team to work on cyber security proposal and collect HL designs, and validates security solution to be proposed. * Works with engineers and SMEs in the development of the technical solution or offering, in translating the business needs into technical requirements, and is a key contributor in the value proposition. * Supports Bid & Proposal solution development including technical design and development of complex proposals for Cyber Security solutions (managed services, System Integration and Consulting). * Run workshops and conduct security assessments to help the client understand their security and privacy issues, risks, exposure and vulnerabilities including architecting secure solutions to address specific security and privacy requirements. * Create high quality documentation such as Presentations, Risk Assessments, Reports and completing metrics and spreadsheets * Develop and deliver quality client presentations (both virtually and in person) * Evaluates and recommends future technologies and methodologies that will enhance our cyber security services and offerings. QUALIFICATIONS: * Minimum 5 years of Solution Architect experience. * Full lifecycle project experience as Security Consultant including design and implementation. * Client facing experience at a range of levels. * Several years of experience in IT security, compliance, and risk management including privacy and controls. * Implementation experience with enterprise security packages identity management and federation systems. * Familiarity with industry compliance and security standards including PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST experience advising customers on architectures meeting industry standards such as SAS70, SOC1, and FISMA. * Preferred Certifications: QSA, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC Why SLAIT? We have been growing since 1990 with offices in Virginia and Raleigh, NC. For over twenty-eight years, we have delivered customized, creative IT solutions for customers in the commercial, and state and local government sectors. * Staff Augmentation * Managed Services * Security Solutions * IT Consulting Thank you for your consideration, please submit your resume today! Visit us at * * Must be able to work for any employer in the United States. No Visa sponsorship.* * SLAIT Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer - provided by Dice

IT security

items.title: Solutions Engineer, Ruby at YouEarnedIt (Austin, TX)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=27, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: HR Services, SaaS
Company size: 51-200 people

Technologies

javascriptreactjsfluxgraphqlruby-on-rails

Job description

About YouEarnedit:

We are passionate about creating happiness for employees that translates into business results for our customers. We focus on employee engagement and improve all levels of recognition so work experience is elevated. Our goal is for the happiness we help create to spread to everyone in the form of increased engagement, improved morale, and greater profitability!

We are a growing company with a bunch of people who take work seriously, who have high levels of accountability and are tons of fun to work with.  We live what we’re preaching.

Overview of the role:

We’re looking for a seasoned Ruby developer with a passion for technical problem-solving and customer relations to join our growing team. As a Solutions Engineer, you’d leverage your technical expertise and coding skills to solve our customers’ problems. You’d investigate, develop, automate, and communicate to get the job done.  

What you'll do:

  • Spend 50% of your time coding creative solutions to customers’ needs and the other 50% interfacing with customers to support their needs
  • Develop time-saving tools and automated processes to reduce integration setup overhead
  • Work with customers’ technical teams to plan, coordinate, and execute on integrations with 3rd party systems
  • Present YouEarnedIt’s technical capabilities and security features to customers in a pre-sales capacity
  • Work with our Customer Success team to triage, investigate, and resolve customer support issues
  • Influence our product’s direction with your ideas and insight into our customers’ needs

What we want from you:

  • A passion for helping customers find elegant solutions to their complex problems
  • Ability to juggle multiple tasks, reorganize/re-prioritize quickly, without feeling overwhelmed.
  • 3+ years working with a web framework: Ruby on Rails a bonus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences alike
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
  • High standards for quality and attention to detail
  • A solid understanding of web fundamentals (HTTP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
  • Proficiency in data mappers such as Mongoid or Active Record
  • Bonus: experience working in a technical, customer-oriented role

To apply - please submit your resume and a cover letter describing why you were inspired to apply with us.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Apply now

Benefits

  • Open Vacation
  • Leave it better days
  • 401k
  • YouEarnedIt as a platform
  • Meaningful Rewards
  • Remote workers
  • Culture of continuous feedback
  • Transparency
  • Wellness
  • Learning & Development

items.title: AmaZix: Security Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Security Manager

Posted May 16

AmaZix
Headquarters: Hong Kong (but entire team is distributed)
https://www.amazix.com/
View all AmaZix jobs →

Operational Security Manager (CISMP, CISM, CISSP) 

AmaZix is the leading provider of community management services for crypto projects. We specialise in helping projects running on the Ethereum blockchain, especially those building up to their ICOs. Projects we work on include Bancor, BANKEX, WePower, GBX and Cardstack.

We are growing extremely fast and from our founding nine months ago we now have over 100 team members and manage over 60 high level projects, with many more asking to come aboard than we can take. We are profitable and have been since day one.

If you are not technically familiar with blockchain based projects then no problem - it is not required. However some knowledge of what Ethereum is would be useful.

Though our company is based in Hong Kong our team is distributed around the world (primarily Europe).

Your position

We are looking for a candidate with extensive experience in an Operational Security Manager role, who can demonstrate ownership and accountability of delivering Security IT Services into a dynamic and remote business. 

  • Minimum one of the following Security qualifications; IS027001 lead Auditor, CISMP, CISM or CISSP
  • Excellent communications skills & be able to translate complex security information into layman's terms for those that are not conversant with security knowledge & services
  • Good knowledge of British & International security standards
  • Ability to work as part of a remote team
  • Ability to develop conceptual models for the delivery of security services
  • Security Risk Management

Responsibilities for this role will include:

  • Managing relationships with the business and with customers
  • Be responsible for all Security related aspects to maintain Security compliance
  • Proactively promote security services
  • Management of security incidents
  • Managing & mitigating threats
  • Writing and maintaining security policies & compliance
  • Adhere to 27001 compliances and develop roadmap to accreditation
  • Ensure operational security input & governance is exercised over all new technical implementations
  • Raise security awareness within the business
  • Manage a security risk register
  • Review & authorise change requests
  • Act as a security point of contact for the business
  • Ensure all security documents are maintained
  • Manage privilege access management
  • Ensure 3rd parties are Security compliant
  • Produce monthly Security report for your line manager
  • Chair & Manage Security meetings & maintain minutes
  • Produce and drive recommendations for security improvements

Requirements:

Perfect command of English (written and spoken)

Invoicing structure and proper registration. Willingness to be paid in Ethereum would be a huge plus.

Able to work full-time. 


Apply for this position

Go to our website: www.amazix.com and press the "Join us" button. Select option "B" and fill out the fields in the Typeform

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote) - Jobmote

Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote)

ConSol Partners

Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect - (Remote anywhere USA) - up to $200K total package - rapidly growing eCommerce specific agency

T** HE **** COMPANY**

One of the USA's fastest growing digital agencies specific to the eCommerce sector. They work with some of the world's biggest and most well-known retailers and brands. Their global projects allow an individual to work on large scale platforms and implementations alongside some of the leading SFCC professionals in the country.

THE ROLE

  • The role will offer the opportunity to work on a SFCC platform on multiple client projects in a fast paced exciting environment
  • Working as a hands on technical expert working with development teams, client requirements and high level roadmaps
  • Joining a growing team at an early stage offering solid career progression
  • Working on multiple client projects and implementations

THE INDIVIDUAL

  • 2+ years' experience in SFCC / Demandware platform
  • 1-2 years' experience at an architect level (someone with a sold technical background on SFCC stepping up into an Architect role could also be a great fit)
  • Software development background (5+ years) ideally around SFCC / Java or related technologies
  • SFCC / Demandware implementation experience highly desirable
  • Strong experience and understanding of HTML/CSS, Javascript, JQuery, XML, Java
  • Ideally worked in an Agile environment

SALARY: up to$200K total package

LOCATION: Remote (anywhere in the USA)

CONSOL PARTNERS

ConSol Partners provide permanent and contract staffing solutions to FTSE & Fortune 500 companies, global brands and start-ups in the technology domains of Communications , Cloud and Digital . Founded in 2008, ConSol Partners have quickly established themselves as one of the world's leading technology recruitment brands.

With headquarters in the City of London and international offices in Los Angeles' "Silicon Beach" and central Boston. Our niche recruitment offering, coupled with an in-depth expert knowledge of our core markets, enables us to offer a true global recruitment solution and we have made placements in over 55 countries.

  • provided by Dice Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote) up to $200k package - top eCommerce specific agency

items.title: Cybersecurity senior Solutions Architect - Remote
items.content:
Cybersecurity senior Solutions Architect - Remote - Jobmote

Cybersecurity senior Solutions Architect - Remote

Slait Consulting

SLAIT Consulting is currently seeking a Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect for our client in Dallas, TX and Richmond, VA.

This is a remote position with some travel required (10%).

SUMMARY:

The Cyber Security Solutions Architect is responsible for working with both BDS Business Development & account/pursuit sales leadership to define security specific solution strategy.

JOB DUTIES /RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for leading the development of technical solutions in the area of cyber security services and offerings.

  • Ensure the soundness of an integrated security solution and proper BDS Delivery assurance signoff of any/all proposals.

  • Primary point contact responsible to ensure governance processes (Ex - Rainbow & BDS Governance) are followed and managed pro-actively through the lifecycle of the pursuit/engagement.

  • Engages with the client, identifies cyber security needs/requirements, engages with SMEs and bid team to work on cyber security proposal and collect HL designs, and validates security solution to be proposed.

  • Works with engineers and SMEs in the development of the technical solution or offering, in translating the business needs into technical requirements, and is a key contributor in the value proposition.

  • Supports Bid & Proposal solution development including technical design and development of complex proposals for Cyber Security solutions (managed services, System Integration and Consulting).

  • Run workshops and conduct security assessments to help the client understand their security and privacy issues, risks, exposure and vulnerabilities including architecting secure solutions to address specific security and privacy requirements.

  • Create high quality documentation such as Presentations, Risk Assessments, Reports and completing metrics and spreadsheets

  • Develop and deliver quality client presentations (both virtually and in person)

  • Evaluates and recommends future technologies and methodologies that will enhance our cyber security services and offerings.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 5 years of Solution Architect experience.

  • Full lifecycle project experience as Security Consultant including design and implementation.

  • Client facing experience at a range of levels.

  • Several years of experience in IT security, compliance, and risk management including privacy and controls.

  • Implementation experience with enterprise security packages identity management and federation systems.

  • Familiarity with industry compliance and security standards including PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST experience advising customers on architectures meeting industry standards such as SAS70, SOC1, and FISMA.

  • Preferred Certifications: QSA, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC

Why SLAIT?

We have been growing since 1990 with offices in Virginia and Raleigh, NC. For over twenty-eight years, we have delivered customized, creative IT solutions for customers in the commercial, and state and local government sectors.

  • Staff Augmentation * Managed Services * Security Solutions * IT Consulting

Thank you for your consideration, please submit your resume today! Visit us at

  • * Must be able to work for any employer in the United States. No Visa sponsorship.* *

SLAIT Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer

  • provided by Dice IT security, risk management, compliance

items.title: Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Architect (Remote)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=3, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=5, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Architect (Remote) - Jobmote

Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Architect (Remote)

BlueGranite

BlueGranite's Solution Architect position is a senior role for individuals with at least twelve years of professional, hands-on experience designing and building business intelligence or data warehouse solutions on the Microsoft platform.

BlueGranite's Solution Architects are expert industry leaders with SQL Server, Power BI, and Azure platforms. They are part of BlueGranite's premier consulting team, leading small-team engagements to design, implement, and support analytics solutions. They demonstrate strong technical leadership skills across components of SQL Server, Power BI and Azure platforms and are able to mentor others with these technologies. Solution Architects may support pre-sales client discussions, project scoping and estimating tasks, and writing statements of work together with our account leadership team.

This full-time, work-from-home consultant position is for individuals who enjoy leading project teams while continuing to work hands-on, building data and analytics solutions using the Microsoft platform.

At a minimum, we're looking for:

  • At least twelve years of hands-on, professional experience with Microsoft data/analytics platforms
  • Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and dimensional modeling techniques
  • Experience developing reports or dashboards
  • Strong aptitude with T-SQL statements and DAX functions
  • Self-starter, quick learner, with a positive, collaborative, and team-based attitude
  • Excellent communication skills, with interests in presenting and blogging
  • Degree in information technology, computer science, business, or engineering
  • Ability to travel across the U.S., with an average of 25% travel to client locations per year
  • Ability to work from home when not on-site at client locations
  • Authorization to work in the U.S., without the requirement for an employment visa

In addition, these score you extra points:

  • Microsoft or other industry certifications for BI, DW, or analytics
  • Microsoft Azure, Power BI, or big data knowledge/experience
  • Interest in advanced analytics, machine learning, and languages including R and Python
  • Demonstration of thought leadership, community volunteering, recognition or awards
  • Master's degree in technology or business

Your primary responsibilities would include:

  • Lead discovery, planning, and architecture design of data and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL, Power BI, and Azure platforms
  • Lead the development of informative and interactive data visualizations/models with SSRS or Power BI
  • Work hands-on with data and analytics components of SQL Server (such as SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, MDS/DQS, or ML Services)
  • Leverage Azure Data Services and Power BI to deliver cloud solutions
  • Write relational, tabular and multidimensional database queries, flows and movements
  • Obtain and maintain technical certifications in these core areas of expertise
  • Add value to each project through effective leadership and team collaboration

BlueGranite is the driving force of data innovation for our customers. We are trusted advisors who use our aptitude and experience to deliver value to our clients. We invest in our team to become better at who we are and what we do. Our core strategy is to lead with offers for data, insights, and analytics that deliver business value on the Microsoft platform.

This position is predominantly remote, work from home, with an average of 25% overnight travel per year. BlueGranite employees are located in Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Colorado, Texas, Minnesota, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, New York, New Hampshire, Florida, or Massachusetts only.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

items.title: Cloud Solutions Architect at Dito (Mountain View, CA)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=1, go=3, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=12, apple=0, java=26, gamedev=0, php=23, embedded=0, frontend=30}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Information Technology, Technology Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Dito is looking for a Cloud Solutions Architect to join our team!   The position is remote so you will get to enjoy the luxuries and flexibility of working from home.  As a Cloud Solutions Architect, the key responsibility will be to drive enterprise infrastructure, applications and analytics to public clouds while supporting the Sales team to develop and earn new business with prospects and existing customers.  The position may be remote but our teams work together closely with you playing a crucial role in addressing “buying” questions that will involve the design and implementations of public and hybrid cloud application architecture, as well as cloud-hosted business intelligence.   You will get to leverage your creative juices and technical abilities around infrastructure, system and application design using web, mobile, cloud, and open source technologies. Experience across various enterprise solutions/ technology stacks (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS) and ability to provide guidance to diverse stakeholders and external vendors will be the foundation of yours and our success!   A few details about your day to day objectives; 

  • Lead change across large platforms / functional areas / organizations to public clouds.
  • Conduct architectural and engineering review of proposed IT investments/solutions to determine the strategic alignment and technical soundness.
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in cloud computing across multiple channels and become a trusted advisor to decision makers.
  • Identify, develop and document repeatable design and implementation methodology 
  • Partner with project teams, vendors, support organizations, functional architects, systems specialists and other technical resources in this hands-on role driving cloud migration/adoption from inception to production implementation.
  • Collaborate with the product, data, and infrastructure architects and be responsible for the defining-designing-delivering the technical architectures, patterns, technical quality, risks, fitness for purpose and operability of technical architecture solutions.
  • Provide technical recommendations to senior executives to assist the decisions on proposed IT investments/solutions and assume responsibility for technical presentations demonstrating a good understanding of application, data, infrastructure, architecture expertise and application systems design. 
  • Lead application workload and data migration, design and build interfaces between applications and other providers, as well as ownership of overall migration effort, workloads, backup and DR services  
  • Able to analyze, design, and implement cloud migration strategies without impacting business continuity 
  • Project scoping skills; methods, knowledge and experience of application processes, development, implementation and deployment to achieve project objectives. 

Skills: Languages: Python, Go, Ruby, Java, PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL

Frameworks: LAMP, J2EE, .NET, Ruby on Rails, Backbone JS, Angular JS, React, Wordpress

Cloud and Automation: Google Cloud (App Engine, Container Engine, Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Cloud Functions, BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc, Datalab, Dataprep, Pub/Sub, Data Studio, TensorFlow, Cloud Deployment Manager, Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud SQL, Google Cloud Bigtable, and Google Cloud Datastore), Chef, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, HAProxy, , Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, RDS, CloudFormation, IAM, Route 53, VPC, SNS, SES, SQS) Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud SQL, Google Cloud Bigtable, and Google Cloud Datastore Big Data: Google BigQuery, Cloudera, Hive, AWS Redshift 
CI / CD / Build: Jenkins, Rundeck, CodeShip.io, Nexus

Monitoring and Logging: StackDriver, Syslog, Splunk, Nagios, New Relic, Cloudwatch

Version Control: Git, Subversion, SVN

OS: RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Windows 2012 Servers

Application Servers: Tomcat, Nginx, Apache

About Dito

Since 2008 we've been helping organizations change the way they do business by leveraging cloud technologies, and more specifically Google Cloud enterprise solutions (Google Cloud Platform, G Suite Business, Chrome Enterprise, and Google Maps).

Benefits

Remote workforce

items.title: Solution Architect (U.S. residents only - Remote position) at StayWell
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Health, Health & Fitness
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are seeking a Solution Architect to play a critical role across our product lines as well as being a thought leader within the technology organization. This role includes definition, architecture and implementation of foundational solutions in support of StayWell product lines. You will be challenged to turn solutions around quickly but thoughtfully, balancing speed to delivery with security, quality, longevity and scalability.

The Solution Architect will also be integral in helping to cultivate an environment of innovation through architectural guidance, technology direction and evangelism of best practices to ensure the team is equipped to deliver industry leading solutions for our customers and patients.  Working within a diverse technology stack the Solution Architect will be instrumental in the modernization and optimization of highly impactful products which help people improve their health and wellness.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following (other duties may be assigned):

  • Design solutions that add value and efficiency across systems. Evaluate and undertake impact analyses on major design options and assess associated risks.
  • Define, maintain, and manage architecture models, frameworks and artifacts (e.g. current and future state application architecture diagrams, data models, etc.).
  • Collaborate closely with management in assessing business strategy and priorities, and tuning solutions to business goals.
  • Collaborate closely with technology system and team leads in determining optimal solutions to product goals, and aligning system/architecture roadmaps to product plans.
  • Support development of cross-functional business processes; identify alternative solutions, assess feasibility, and recommend new approaches via technology enablement. Evaluate the system factors which must be addressed in change management.
  • Develop and manage expectations for communication channels and/or stakeholder groups. Initiate communications between key contributors and stakeholders, acting as a single point of contact for cross-functional solution architecture. Facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders.
  • Stay informed on technology trends and product roadmaps to make strategic solution architecture recommendations.


Qualified candidates will have experience in the following:

  • Direct experience with product development in an enterprise setting, leveraging modern technology stacks and cloud-based systems such as AWS.
    • Significant experience with Node.js highly preferred
    • Experience React and React Native preferred
  • Strong knowledge of various integration approaches such as microservices, messaging, queuing, API patterns, etc.
  • Experience leading / managing an enterprise development work stream involving several systems, teams and user profiles.
  • Strong understanding of agile methodologies (Scaled Agile Framework preferred)
  • Ability to interact at all levels of the client organization
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment


Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's degree (B. S.) in Computer related subject area or related business field and eight (8) or more year’s experience in Information Technology and solution delivery, or equivalent combination of education and experience in similar fields is required. Experience working with SAAS based solution delivery organization (preferred).

About StayWell

At StayWell, we believe in the transformational power of health. Through the science of behavior change, education and inspiration, we have taken the guess work out of healthy living. And we do this by empowering people to take active roles in their own health – whether they’re patients, employees, or individuals just trying to stay well. We help inspire people to become healthier, happier employees at work. We help them have a more balanced and rewarding life at home. And we provide information that helps make patients smarter. In fact, everything we do maximizes the likelihood of the best possible outcomes. Which has a positive impact on families, businesses and communities. Because there is no mission more important than improving human health.

StayWell has a 40-year history of unparalleled expertise in improving health – whether at the point of care, in the workplace, or at home. But we know that every day the way people consume information is changing. We are continually working to integrate our proven, evidence-based solutions into forward-thinking, tech-driven delivery mechanisms, ensuring that we provide people with the right information, at the right time, and in the right way to maximize our impact on health outcomes. Our organization places great weight on technical innovation, and we’re looking for awesome tech talent to catalyze our momentum.

Our team is nearly 100% remote. We create several different product lines related to our health and wellness business and patient education content. Our history, our access to member and patient data, and the relationships we have established put us in a very unique position of truly being able to make a difference as it relates to improving our healthcare system.  

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Fitness Center and Fitness Reimbursement
Medical plans, dental and vision coverage
Work from home options
Health Savings Account, Flex Savings Account
401K Retirement Savings Plan
Tuition assistance, paid time for volunteerism

items.title: Cloud Solutions Developer (Go) at Dito
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=22, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=18, nodejs=16, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=1, apple=0, java=44, gamedev=0, php=11, embedded=0, frontend=91}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Information Technology, Technology Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Who are We?

Dito is a closely-knit team comprised of brilliant minds with a singular focus; to enable companies of all sizes to make the most of their technology by leveraging Google Cloud technology.  We are a distributed team and have the distinguished honor of being one of very few service providers considered a Google Cloud Premier Partner.

***This position is remote however you are required to be located in Standard Eastern Timezone***

What Will You Do?

From Gaming to Healthcare to the Finance industry, helping our customers architect and developing solutions and applications will be your primary focus.  Understanding and potentially being able to use different tools in the appropriate situation, such as Go, jQuery, Python, AngularJS, React, Backbone, Mustache, and Node.js will be important - as is the ability to solve problems with a variety of tools. You have built applications on Google App Engine and/or Container Engine or other cloud platform, and are comfortable modeling data with Google’s Datastore.

Who are You?

You spend hours learning web/mobile development frameworks, and are never satisfied with a solution being ‘good enough’.  Keeping up with the most cutting edge technology the world has to offer - you know that the Google Cloud Platform is poised to be the most advanced system in the world.

You’ve already built some apps that integrate with their REST APIs, and consider yourself skilled in Apps Script, App Engine, Compute Engine, Container Engine, DataStore, CloudSQL, Cloud Storage, Big Query and are eager to expand your knowledge of the Maps APIs and Machine Learning.  You’ve got a few go to frameworks like Angular.js and jQuery, and have experience developing applications in Python, GO, PHP, Java, Angular.js and other JavaScript libraries.

The Technical Stuff

Responsibilities:

  • Develop professional, highly scalable and interactive web and mobile applications as custom solutions for clients
  • Full lifecycle application development
  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.
  • Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis using the Agile Scrum development process
  • Performance unit-based software testing and quality assurance while building out the application
  • Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation
  • Support, maintain and document software functionality
  • Integrate software with existing systems
  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation
  • Work closely with Project Manager on client discovery, project estimating and project progression, testing, deployment, and iterations
  • Maintain standards compliance

Preferred Qualifications:

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Proficiency in Go, Javascript (JQuery, AngularJS, React), HTML5, CSS, REST and JSON
  • Experience with the following: Python, PHP, Java, Javascript, Go, Django, Flask, XML, SOAP
  • Database design (Multi-tenant App Engine and/or Container engine design experience preferred)
  • Experience with the following is preferred:  Google App Engine (GAE), Google Maps Engine, Google Web Toolkit (GWT), MySQL, NoSQL (MongoDB), CartoDB
  • Work in an Agile Scrum development methodology
  • Experience with Atlassian Jira a plus
  • Multi-threaded web/mobile application programming
  • Great Analytical & Troubleshooting Skills
  • Great Communication & Customer Service Skills
  • Solutions Oriented Critical Thinking Skills

About Dito

Dito is a full-service cloud advisory and services firm providing sales, development, change management, and ongoing customer success services to organizations interested in moving to & operating in the cloud.

Since 2008 we've been helping organizations change the way they do business by leveraging cloud technologies, and more specifically to Google Cloud enterprise solutions (Google Cloud Platform, G Suite Business, Chrome Enterprise, and Google Maps) and other complimentary cloud service solutions.

Benefits

Remote workforce

items.title: PHP + Laravel Engineer at High-Growth FinTech Company at Lenox Park Solutions LLC (Austin, TX)

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Financial Technology, Investment Banking, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Lenox Park Solutions is seeking a PHP Engineer with 2-5 years of commercial experience. As a PHP Engineer, you would work closely with our Development team to code and test functionality which will directly increase the scalability of Roundtables, our flagship product which will disrupt and revitalize the Asset Management industry. The junior developer will work directly with an experienced Senior PHP Engineer in helping to execute platform development, and will have the opportunity to grow within the organization as LPS expands it technical team. At LPS, we focus on accountability, proactive-ness, and creative thinking. Staff members retain the option to work remotely, as we are a goals-oriented team.

  • Requirements:
    • Professional experience on PHP, specifically with Laravel, VueJS/ReactJS, and Git, and preferably with Laravel Queues, Websockets, Amazon Web Services, and Linux (Ubuntu);
    • Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written experience with technical and non-technical audiences;
    • Ability to assess ongoing processes critically and recommend creative, thoughtful operational improvements;
  • Preferred Skills:
    • Understanding of Asset Management industry;
    • Business-oriented, highly analytical mind with a knack for accounting for both complex business and technical considerations simultaneously

About Lenox Park Solutions LLC

Lenox Park Solutions LLC (LPS) is a FinTech firm focused on Asset Managers and Financial Institutions. Our mission is to enable the democratization of access to Institutional capital by using technology to match best-in-class Asset Allocators with the most talented Asset Managers. Our solutions will challenge entrenched traditional notions of who should be able to manage money, upending the staid model where pedigree and privilege drive capital allocation. Leveraging deep experience in investment banking and asset management, LPS licenses CRM solutions that emphasize networking and collaboration to manage Fundraising, Deal Pipeline, Business Development and Operations. LPS maintains offices in New York, NY and Austin, TX.

Benefits

Remote Office
Experienced Investment Professionals
Austin and New York Offices
Lean, Entrepreneurial Team

items.title: ServiceNow ITSM Solution Architect (Remote or Local)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
ServiceNow ITSM Solution Architect (Remote or Local) - Jobmote

ServiceNow ITSM Solution Architect (Remote or Local)

Evanios

Job Description

  • This position may be located at our Orlando, FL headquarters, or remote. Resume and cover letter are required.

Looking to ramp up your career with a fast-growing company? Check out Evanios!

We build software that utilizes preconfigured logic, machine learning algorithms, and ITSM contextual data to automatically reduce alert noise, prioritize events, identify root cause and predict outages before they occur. Used primarily by Fortune 1000 customers, our flagship SaaS application enhances ServiceNow™, a dominant platform for enterprise companies.

Since we focus on producing exceptional results, our clients often ask us to work in adjacent spaces (e.g. ServiceNow CMDB, Orchestration, Incident, Problem, Change Management, etc.). Based on growing demand for these services, we're looking for the right people to join our team.

Your Role

As a ServiceNow ITSM Solution Architect, you will be highly visible to our customers and prospects. You will collaborate with sales and professional services team members, and you will be responsible for all aspects of project and solution delivery including scoping, project planning, ensuring client satisfaction, workshop hosting, and achievement of required business outcomes and deliverables.

You will also share your knowledge and insights by mentoring other ITSM consultants while informing and educating our audience on the proper ITSM best practices. Besides technical leadership, you will also be performing implementation work in addition to other activities. You should be able to mockup diagram concepts, create presentations, write and speak effectively.

This role requires a high level of attention to detail. To meet our initial qualification criteria you are required to provide a cover letter that points out how you meet all of the required skills and experience listed below. Use this as an opportunity to show us how well you will fit with our culture, and that you have the skills necessary to thrive as a member of our team.

Additionally, you will…

Be a go-to authority for internal team members. We're a highly cross-functional organization, so you'll be working closely with project management, junior and senior consultants, and management.

Establish customer requirements and drive continuous improvement of user experience, implementation methodology, and service offerings based on client experiences while guiding team members and performing implementation tasks when needed.

Define future processes through workshop delivery and data collection.

Provide details about dependencies, key integration points, and building of the roadmap for the ITSM solution while extending the solution across multiple Lines of Business and various groups within the client organization.

Provide a clear business vision, and best practice recommendations around implementation choices, system design, integrations, and system enhancements.

Align Business and Technology Strategies and own strategic responsibility for client ITSM and Service Automation systems

Assist Sales and Services with scoping and estimating customer requirements and associated work effort to achieve customers technical and business goals.

Required Skills & Experience:

Minimum 10 years of ITSM experience with tools such as ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, HP ServiceManager, Cherwell.

Minimum 5 years of proven experience as an ITSM Solution Architect and Team Lead for enterprise customers.

ServiceNow Implementer Certification, or proven experience.

ServiceNow Administrator and/or Developer Certifications, or proven experience.

Proven experience scoping, estimating, workshop delivery, and implementing all of the following SN Modules: Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Knowledge Management, Request Management, and Configuration Management (CMDB).

Additional Skills & Experience:

Knowledgeable of the following SN Modules: Asset Management, Service Portal, Service Mapping, Cloud Management, and Discovery.

Administrative experience building interfaces and integrations from ITSM tools to other applications and data sources. API Integration Tools and REST API.

Development Methodologies: Knowledge of Waterfall, RUP, and Agile development. Experience guiding customers through development methodologies and best practice. Experience with ServiceNow Agile/SDLC or similar tools is a plus.

ITIL Foundations V3 Certification; ITIL Intermediate or higher certification a plus

Exceptional documentation skills. Ability to build professional customer facing documentation such as Requirements and Design Documents as well as PowerPoint slide decks for technology and process workshops.

Exceptional presentation skills. Proven experience leading customer facing meetings to a wide-ranging audience, i.e. Technical to Executive Level

Evanios offers a competitive salary, generous vacation, medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401k, paid life insurance, career growth opportunity, and a great work environment. This role may include occasional travel.

Please note: Your resume and cover letter are both required for consideration. Applications without either component will be disregarded.

Company DescriptionLed by a team of seasoned veterans in the IT Operations Management space, we have infused our direct experience, respected methodology standards, and advanced machine learning into a best-in-class product that drastically reduces unnecessary alerts and low-level manual decision making from complex IT environments. Our innovative software solutions are trusted by some of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies.

Evanios sets a new standard for best in class, creates innovative solutions that provide quick time to value and pushes the industry to evolve. We deliver the impossible while maintaining an environment where our team members thrive professionally and personally.

items.title: Azure Technical Specialist - Remote/Virtual Role
items.content:
Azure Technical Specialist - Remote/Virtual Role - Jobmote

Azure Technical Specialist - Remote/Virtual Role

Global IT Family

Job Title: Azure Technical Specialist

Location: Virtual Role - Can be located anywhere in the US.

Duration: 12 months contract

Job Details:

This resource is remote so they can sit anywhere in the US.

Candidates must be able to engage with the customer, understand what they are running and help them transition to the Cloud, understand what the cost/impact is going to be, provide industry best practices and knowledge.

Required:

Strong technical experience is a must - looking for the candidate to fit more into a solution role because they have to engage with the customer. Manager looking to make this hire very quickly!!

Responsibilities:

  • The Azure Technical Specialist is a technical customer facing role that will be responsible for the end to end customer data platform design, architecture, and deployment.
  • The ideal candidate will have experience in a customer facing roles and have led successful technical and economic value discussions with senior customer executives, driving decisions and implementation.
  • Supporting customers across all lines of business, the ATS will balance both sales and delivery priorities.
  • The ATS will help customers establish objectives and requirements for a successful cloud migration.
  • The ATS will also be responsible for helping develop and deliver a level of technical support to existing SLMS cloud customers.
    • provided by Dice Azure, Cloud support, Cloud design, cloud Architecture, Cloud technical support

items.title: Solutions Architect
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION
Winnow are now hiring to expand their software development team. We're a mission led, product-focused high-growth tech scale-up that's going global and breaking new ground in tech. We get a kick out of helping our blue-chip customers and the world prevent food waste through great products and services. Our team have the kind of culture, alignment, energy, and passion you read articles about. If that sounds like something you want to be a part of, today is the day to get in touch.

Us:

Passionate about technology and innovation
Agile throughout the organisation
Moving fast to test-driven development and continuous delivery
Product stack spans from mobile apps to Linux-powered hardware in the field and everything powered by our software written in various computer languages (Java, Python, Node.js and others) using a number AWS services and Pentaho/Kettle for analytics/reporting


REQUIREMENTS
You:

Have a solid understanding of programming (not just using existing frameworks and plugins but understanding what they do, how they work and if needed build/extend them)
Can program using at least two programming languages and eager to learn more if needed to complete a project that requires a different specialisation and help your colleagues
Are passionate about TDD, thinking how to test and are not trying to ‘escape’ writing Unit or Integration tests. Each developer in Winnow is responsible and accountable for their delivered work.
Able to estimate effort to deliver initiatives and do your best to deliver on your commitment
Keen on continuous improvement, design, implement, release, learn and improve on every iteration
Want to prototype solutions using new cutting-edge technologies and present them to the team or to the world
Ready to engage in our mission to reduce food waste
Comfortable in a fast-moving small company environment
A good communicator with both technical and non-technical people and can work with remote team members

BENEFITS
Competitive base salary
Life insurance (3 times base salary)
Employee assistance programme
Company part-funded health insurance
Matching pension scheme
Cycle to work scheme
25 days of paid vacation time in addition to national holidays
You will love what you do – waking up every day solving one of the biggest social problems of our generation
Committed team members with broad experience who share a common passion to build a world class business
Great office space in central London with free happy hours and a great working environment

items.title: Customer Solution Engineer

items.content:
The Role

You’re the technical glue that enable customers to automate their workflow or to help them diagnose and fix issues. Problem solving is a hobby you can’t live without and you love a challenging bug hunt!

With the engineering team you will develop and apply internal software tools to automate tasks within the SafetyCulture team. Our customers can always rely on you to demonstrate integrations and provide technical support during and after deployment.

Simple data types are no surprise to you and you’re not phased by data formats, especially JSON, CSV, XML.

The Soul

You live and breathe solutions but you don’t keep your best ideas to yourself. You’re an effective communicator and team worker and contribute your insights from your interaction with customers to help refine technical requirements.

You are passionate about tech and you’re a product advocate who is passionate about putting safety and quality in the hands of every worker. The customer is always top of mind and you will be influential in creating user-facing setup and usage guides.

Languages? That would be great! Some software development such as Javascript and/or Python preferred but not limited to would be amazing.

The Responsibilities

- Take customer requirements via identified channels
- Work closely with our customer success team to assist customers in getting setup with existing integration solutions
- Assessing/scoping of needed API and Integration improvements/solutions
- Work with core API development team to prioritise any needed API improvements
- Build upon API improvements to develop new integration solutions for customer needs or to improve existing integration solutions

Desired Skills

- JIRA/Confluence or similar experience
- Using 'DevTools' in a web browser to diagnose issues
- Data syncing concepts (e.g. push vs pull model)
- General understanding of web services and REST API/CRUD fundamentals
- REST API client development
- Technical writing
- Experience using and/or integrating with any of the following
- Sharepoint, SalesForce, PowerBI, Tableau, Google Sheets, Zapier, Microsoft Flow

Why SafetyCulture

- We’re operating at a scale few other companies are, and you’ll be doing challenging work that impacts millions every day and helps to move the world forward.
- We have money in the bank and plentiful investors knocking on our doors
- We have HUGE ambitions. We aren’t scared to aim for tens of millions of users by 2025
- We operate within a largely untapped market with endless possibilities and we are a part of a new, exciting wave of SaaS companies that focus on frontline workers
- We know a thing or two about making our employees happy, and we go the extra mile connecting our people to our mission. The experience trips are an example of how we're pushing the boundaries of company culture and employee engagement

Location

There is always something to explore in Manchester! Between the booming restaurant scene, interesting museums and galleries, and theatre and arts, Manchester is thriving. Not to mention, they can pour a good pint. Our office is located within a new collaborative workspace with plenty of tech startups in the mix.

items.title: NCC Group (formerly Matasano Security, iSEC Partners, and Intrepidus Group) - Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Houston, ...
items.content:
NCC Group (formerly Matasano Security, iSEC Partners, and Intrepidus Group) - Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Houston, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, and Sunnyvale, CA

It's the time of year when we welcome back the sun, the cherry blossoms, and crippling seasonal allergies. 2 of out 3 ain't bad. Searching for a job that goes 3 for 3? Consider NCC. Cutting-edge research, continuous learning & training, and contributing on interesting client engagements. The elusive triple threat.

NCC Group is currently looking for passionate security minds to join our merry crew! We are looking for great people to join our pentesting, DFIR, and Risk Management & Governance teams!

What do we do exactly? Penetration testing, security analysis, DFIR, and cutting-edge research into current technologies and attacks (breaking things). You spend most of your day thinking about security systems and how they can break. You get to be creative and have a lot of freedom to be clever while learning new technologies at a very fast pace. Engagements are usually 2-4 weeks long and in a year you will be exposed to 15-20 products and technology stacks. Your work will typically initiate person-months of security improvements in products millions of people use. You will have access to senior engineers/architects and your findings/ideas will be heard by senior decision makers. You will have enormous impact in making the software and products people use safer!

All of our consultants are also security researchers, with dedicated research time. Not too shabby!

We are looking to add new colleagues in all of our office locations. Specifically, we're urgently looking to add folks in the following service offerings:

* Houston! We're eagerly looking for junior and senior pentesters in the Houston market to help protect our growing client base locally. * Experienced, seasoned pentesters in all of our office locations (and remote, if willing to travel)* Great DFIR minds in the Bay Area, NYC, or Austin (or remote, if willing to travel)* Additions to our Risk Management & Governance team all over the country* Junior pentesting additions to our team in every office location

If you want to learn more about us and our open positions check out our:

Blog (https://www.nccgroup.trust/us/about-us/newsroom-and-events/b...)

Cryptopals (http://cryptopals.com/)

Microcorruption (https://microcorruption.com/login)

If you're ready to apply, contact us at https://www.nccgroup.trust/us/about-us/careers/current-vacan... or reach out directly at na-cv@nccgroup.trust.

We'd love to hear from you! Have a good day!
